How to Get Voter Data in Kansas

November 17, 2025 kansas voter-data voter-list voter-history

Kansas provides access to voter registration data for $200 through a mail-in request process. The state operates under the Kansas Open Records Act (KORA), which governs access to public records including voter registration information.

Quick Summary

Category Details
Statewide Cost $200
Voter List Access Mail-in request form
Voter History Access Unclear - recommend inquiry
Delivery Method Contact SOS for delivery details
Processing Time After form and payment received

Voter List

Kansas provides voter registration data through the Secretary of State’s office under KORA (Kansas Open Records Act) provisions.

How to Access

  1. Review the KORA Policy Statement for general information
  2. Download the Computerized Voter Registration Form (CVR)
  3. Complete the CVR form
  4. Mail the completed form with payment ($200) to the address specified on the form
  5. Receive voter data after processing

What’s Included

The computerized voter registration file includes information for registered voters in Kansas.

Voter History

The availability of voter history data is not explicitly spelled out in the available documentation.

Recommendation

When submitting your CVR form, specifically ask about:

  • Whether voter history is included with the voter registration file
  • Whether voter history is available as a separate file
  • What historical coverage is provided
  • Any additional cost for voter history

It’s recommended to call the Secretary of State’s office to confirm voter history availability before submitting your request.

Cost

Kansas charges $200 for the statewide computerized voter registration file.

Restrictions and Permitted Uses

Kansas voter data is subject to the Kansas Open Records Act (KORA). When requesting Kansas voter data, users must comply with state laws regarding the use of public records and voter registration information.

Review the KORA Policy Statement for detailed information about:

  • Access rights
  • Permitted uses
  • Legal requirements
  • Processing procedures

Technical Notes

KORA Framework

Kansas provides voter data under its open records law framework, which balances public access with privacy protections and appropriate use requirements.

Delivery Method

Contact the Secretary of State’s office or review the CVR form for information about how data is delivered after approval and payment.

Testing Status

This system has not been independently tested. Contact the Kansas Secretary of State for current information about:

  • Processing timelines
  • Payment methods
  • Delivery methods
  • File formats
  • Voter history availability

Contact Information

Kansas Secretary of State - Elections Division

  • Website: https://sos.ks.gov/elections/
  • KORA Information: KORA Policy Statement
  • CVR Form: Computerized Voter Registration Form

Kansas provides voter registration data through a straightforward mail-in request process at a moderate cost of $200. The KORA framework ensures public access while maintaining appropriate oversight. Be sure to contact the Secretary of State to confirm voter history availability before submitting your request.
